news.title: Word of the Day
news.description:
Net Profit Margin
Net profit margin shows how much profit is earned out of the total revenue.
It is expressed in percentage. Net profit margin = Net Income/Revenue.
In the financial statements of a company, you can find this under the ratios subhead of its income statement.

news.title: 6 Day Course
news.description:
Theme: checklist before buying real estate
Day 3: Wednesday
Conversion and permits: many properties are in zones and can only be used for designated purposes like commercial use, residential use, institutional use, etc.
Check the zoning rules and the ability to change the use.
NOC: No Objection Certificate (NOC) is given by any authority that has a say in any matter.
Depending on where the property is located, there could be several authorities (municipality, fire department, excise department, etc) that need to give the property owner an NOC before the property is used.
Find out all the NOCs needed. Then, find out how many of the required NOCs are not obtained already.
Some NOCs are easy to get. Some NOCs can be difficult to obtain. Factor these before deciding on a property purchase.

news.title: Featured Question
news.description:
"What are the basic difference between balanced and balanced advantage mutual fund? What is suitable for a senior citizen of low risk appetite?"
 
Balanced funds are funds that invest in both equity (eg. share markets) and debt (bonds, fixed-income securities, etc).
A conservative balanced fund invests a majority of its money in debt and a smaller portion in equity.
An aggressive balanced fund invests a majority of its money in equity and a smaller portion in debt.
A balanced advantage fund is one that can switch between being a majority in equity or a majority in debt.
It does not have to stick to being just debt-heavy or just equity-heavy.
Suitability for senior citizens: this is really an individual decision. Senior citizens are usually less risk-taking.
But then, many argue all balanced funds are relatively lower-risk than equity funds.
There is no right or wrong answer. Each investor should evaluate and invest.

introduction.content:
Fact: Nifty has fallen between 0% and 1% about 415 times in the last 5 years.
The markets ended in the red today.
However the change was almost flat, mostly because of mixed global cues.
The day started with the markets erasing Tuesday's gains. The US and Asian markets along with SGX Nifty ended lower.
The reopening of the Chinese economy has raised concerns about the spread of the virus. But it may also revive demand for goods - reasons that led to mixed global cues.
Energy, realty, auto, and consumption stocks ended in the green today.
